title: Ohms law - current vs pd graph for ohmic material

content.question: In the following graphs of the current in a circuit element as a function of the potential difference across the element, which graph indicates the correct relation for a resistor made from an ohmic material?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Potential Difference,” the vertical axis is labeled “Current,” and no values are indicated along them. The line begins above the origin at the top of the vertical axis, and moves horizontally to the right to end at the end of the horizontal axis and at the top of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Potential Difference,” the vertical axis is labeled “Current,” and no values are indicated along them. The line begins at the origin, and slants upward and to the right to end at the end of the horizontal axis and at the top of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Potential Difference,” the vertical axis is labeled “Current,” and no values are indicated along them. The curve begins at the origin and starts horizontal, then moves to the right and upward slowly at first and then more rapidly, and ends at the end of the horizontal axis and at the top of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Potential Difference,” the vertical axis is labeled “Current,” and no values are indicated along them. The curve begins at the origin and starts almost vertical, then moves to the right and upward rapidly at first and then more slowly, and ends at the end of the horizontal axis and at the top of the vertical axis.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Potential Difference,” the vertical axis is labeled “Current,” and no values are indicated along them. The line begins at the origin, and slants upward and to the right to end at the end of the horizontal axis and at the top of the vertical axis.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
